thread.title: New Gambian leader Adama Barrow sworn in at ceremony in Senegal
thread.title_full: New Gambian leader Adama Barrow sworn in at ceremony in Senegal

author: Reuters in Dakar
title: New Gambian leader Adama Barrow sworn in at ceremony in Senegal
text:
The Gambia New Gambian leader Adama Barrow sworn in at ceremony in Senegal 
Ceremony comes as west African states ramp up pressure on Yahya Jammeh, who has refused to step down Adama Barrow is sworn in as president of Gambia at the country’s embassy in Dakar, Senegal. Photograph: AP Reuters in Dakar   17.15 GMT Last modified on   17.19   Share on Messenger Close 
Adama Barrow has been sworn in as the Gambia’s president at a ceremony in the country’s embassy in neighbouring Senegal, as regional troops prepared to back him in a showdown with the defiant incumbent, Yahya Jammeh . 
The country has been in a state of political uncertainty since Jammeh refused to cede power to the winner of last month’s presidential election, using the courts and parliament to try to extend his 22-year rule. 
Barrow was inaugurated in a hastily arranged ceremony in a small embassy room that held about 40 people, including Senegal’s prime minister and the head of the Gambia’s electoral commission. 
A large TV screen broadcast the swearing-in ceremony to several hundred watching outside the embassy. 
Also at the event were officials from west Africa’s regional bloc, Ecowas, which is threatening to invade the Gambia to force Jammeh to step down. 
The UN security council was set to vote later on Thursday on a draft resolution endorsing the west African regional force’s efforts to remove Jammeh.
